thread.title: U.S. Government Bonds Decline as Borrowing Revs up

author: Daniel Kruger
title: U.S. Government Bonds Decline as Borrowing Revs up
text:
The yield on the benchmark 10-year Treasury note snapped two days of declines, rising to 2.904% from 2.877% Friday.
Yields rise as bond prices fall.
The Treasury is selling $151 billion of short-term bills to help manage its cash flow as the government sends out tax refunds and awaits payments, which tend to come in closer to the April 15... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
